#summary Linear Virtual Addressing

http://virtualagc.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/Apollo32.png 
= Linear Virtual Addressing =

Although the real AGC used banked memory for addressing its Erasable and Fixed memory most debug front-ends use linear addressing. To facilitate debugging in existing gdb front-ends a  virtual linear memory map was created based on the original Octal Pseudo Addressing devised by the people at MIT in the early sixties.

= Memory Map =

The following memory map shows how the linear virtual address maps to the actual banked memory in the AGC.
